creator.name: Portugees Israëlitische gemeente van Curaçao
creator.his_func: The first groups of Sephardic Jewish settlers arrived on Curaçao in the 1650s from Amsterdam. They set up plantations on the shores of the Schottengat, in an area which became known as the Jodenkwartier (Jewish Quarter), during the 1660s. But soon most Jews established themselves as merchants and settled in the walled town of Willemstad. Synagogues were built in Willemstad and later also on the opposite side of the harbour, which was known as the Overzijde van de haven (the other side of the harbour) or Otrobanda. The Sefardic population retained close ties with the Portuguese Jewish community of Amsterdam.
